NKD: Preletanja uvode ekstremnu desnicu u lokalne parlamente

06 Nov 2019, 09:55

Nacionalna koalicija za decentralizaciju (NKD) upozorila je danas da  je organizovanim preletanjem odbornika i većnika širom Srbije, ekstremno-desničarska stranka "Srpska desnica" ušla  u lokalne parlamente, čak i lokalne vlasti, bez jednog jedinog glasa na izborima."Besmisao postojećeg izbornog sistema, u kojem glasači ne znaju zapravo za koga glasaju jer svoj glas poveravaju strankama, pretvorio se u sistem trgovine mandatima na lokalnom nivou", istakli su u NKD-u.U toj organizaciji podsećaju da je Centar za istraživanje, transparentnost i odgovornost (CRTA) od  2016. do 2019. godine registrovao da je 657 odbornika i odbornica promenilo stranku u 107 gradova i opština u Srbiji, najčešće u pravcu prelaska u vladajuće stranke."Konačna brojka je svakako daleko veća (ukupno 9.130), ali je svakako reč je o značajnom procentu odbornika u Srbiji , koji su praktično oteli glasove date njihovim partijama i listama i preneli ih drugoj stranci", navodi se u saopštenju NKD-a.Prema procenama NKD-a, oko 250.000 glasova sa prošlih lokalnih izbora oteto je preletanjem i političkom trgovinom partija, suprotno izraženoj volji glasača na izborima.U saopštenju se dodaje da NKD-u nije poznato da je pokrenuta bilo kakva istraga u vezi sa mogućom trgovinom uticajem koja je u Srbiji krivično delo."Po statistikama inicijative "Ko je na vlasti", iz opozicije u vlast je preletelo 28 odsto preletača, a dodatnih 35 odsto preletača je prešlo iz jedne u drugu stranku na vlasti, kao što je slučaj i sa kreiranjem nove stranke na vlasti, "Srpske desnice", naveli su u NKD-u.Prema njihovim rečima, poseban problem u slučajevima preletanja u "Srpsku desnicu" jeste to što vlast očigledno orkestrira stvaranje nove ekstremističke stranke, koja javno promoviše nasilje, mržnju i "tvrdu ruku države" koja mora biti "oštrija" prema neistomišljenicima i protivnicima vlasti.Kako su naveli u NKD-u, do sada je zabeležen ulazak "Srpske desnice" u lokalne samouprave najviše na jugu Srbije. Prvi slučaj ulaska ove stranke u lokalnu vlast zabeležen je jula ove godine u Vranju, a poslednji prvih dana novembra u gradskoj opštini Palilula u Nišu."Postoje indicije i da se sistem partijskog zapošljavanja u javnim institucijama koristi za "motivisanje" ljudi da predju u "Srpsku desnicu", kao i mogućnost "direktnijeg kontakta sa predsednikom Aleksandrom Vučićem, mnogo lakše nego kroz SNS strukture", kazali su u NKD-u.Po mišljenju NKD-a, promena izbornog sistema u pravcu personalizacije izabranih odbornika i poslanika jedini je izlaz iz ove situacije u kojoj su političke partije zarobile politiku i institucije i gde glasači nemaju nikakav uticaj na to koga njihov glas dovodi na mesto odlučivanja."Aktuelni način biranja predstavnika gradjana doveden je do apsurda, jer glasačima niko ne garantuje da njihov glas neće u fotelje dovesti ekstremističku opciju, koja ne samo da se kosi sa njihovom voljom, već je i zloupotrebljava", istakli su u NKD-u.

NKD: Flyovers introduce the far right into local parliaments

06 Nov 2019, 09:55

The National Coalition for Decentralization (NKD) warned today that, with organized flyovers of councilors and councilors across Serbia, the far-right Serb Right Party entered local parliaments, even local governments, without a single vote in the election. , in which voters do not really know who they are voting for because they entrust their vote to the parties, has turned into a local mandate trading system, "the NKD noted. The organization is reminded that the Center for Research, Transparency and Accountability (CRTA) since 2016 By 2019, he had registered that 657 councilors had changed the party in 107 cities and municipalities in Serbia, most often in the direction of moving to the ruling parties. "The final figure is certainly far higher (9,130 in total), but it is certainly a significant percentage. councilors in Serbia, who virtually abducted the votes given to their parties and lists and passed them on to another party, "the NKD said in a statement. According to the NKD, some 250,000 votes from past local elections have been hijacked by party flyovers and political trade, contrary to the expressed will of the electorate. The statement added that the NKD is not aware that any investigation has been launched into the possible trafficking in influence, which is a criminal offense in Serbia. "According to statistics from the Who's in Power initiative, 28 percent of flyers have flown from power to the government, and an additional 35 percent of flyers have switched from one party to another in power, as in the case and with the creation of a new party in power, the "Serb Right," they cited in the NKD.According to them, a particular problem in cases of a move to the "Serbian Right" is that the government apparently orchestrates the creation of a new extremist party that publicly promotes violence, hatred and the "hard hand of the state", which must be "sharper" towards non-thinkers and opponents of the government. more in the south of Serbia. The first case of this party's entry into local government was recorded in Vranje this July, and the last in the first days of November in Palilula, Nis. "There are indications that the system of party employment in public institutions is being used to" motivate "people to enter" The Serbian right, "as well as the possibility of" more direct contact with President Aleksandar Vucic, much easier than through the SNS structures, "the NKD said. According to the NKD, changing the electoral system towards personalizing elected councilors and deputies is the only way out This is a situation where political parties are trapped by politics and institutions and where voters have no influence over who their vote brings to the decision-making site. "The current way of electing citizens is absurd, because no one guarantees voters that their vote will not lead them to armchairs. the extremist option, which not only defies their will, but also abuses it, "the NKD noted.
